授業目的: This course is an exploration of the contour and characteristics of Japanese foodways in modern times with reference to historical developments in the country as well as global trends. Emphasizing the tension between change and continuity, it challenges students to examine such theoretical issues as identity, global trade, and social change in Japan and around the world through the prism of food.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a critical understanding of Japanese foodways today as well as its relations to history, politics, economics, and culture. Through the writing assignments, they will acquire skills in social and cultural analysis and expository writing.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業の概要・背景: This is a student presentation and discussion centered course. There will be only occasional mini lectures.
授業方法: Student presentation, in-class discussion, mini lectures when appropriate.

第1回:
First 3 classes will be on demand only. In-person classes start from 4th week.
Please see syllabus attached below.
